page.title: 16HALMEREND HALL FARM
page.content: Halmerend Hall Farm is one of the largest farms in our block.It is owned by the Richardson family who have lived there for over 49 years.Mr Richardson however did not know when the farmhouse was originally built. The land being farmed is over 204 hectares and includes land which used tobelong to Pheasants Hays Farm.Three men work on the farm although the whole family help out when busy.Some crops are grown,but the land is mostly grass for grazing or cutting as hay/silage. Altogather,there are 210 cows on the farm and 150 cubical sheds are needed for them.The farm also has 5 tractors, 1 combine harvester and 1 hay bailer. Mr Richardson works nearly 100 hours a week when very busy e.g. harvest time and is also busy when he takes cattle to be sold in nearby Newcastle. Class B3
